bioghist.p: Henry J. Pemberton, Jr. (1855-1913), was an inventor and chemist born in Philadelphia, Pa., Sept. 13, 1855. He was the son of Henry and Caroline Town (Hollingsworth) Pemberton. The first of the family in America was Ralph Pemberton, a native of England who arrived in Maryland in November, 1682, and later settled in Bucks County, Pa. Henry Pemberton graduated A.M. at the University of Pittsburgh in 1876 and then entered the junior class of the University of Pennsylvania as a special student, subsequently receiving a certificate of proficiency from that institution. He married Susan Lovering of Philadelphia on Mar. 28, 1894, and had four children.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of genealogical research related to the Pemberton and associated families. Documentation includes: correspondence to Henry Pemberton, Jr., of Philadelphia related to genealogical research on the Craft and Lovering families (Loverings of Massachusetts and Delaware; letters to/from Susan Lovering; a genealogical chart and pedigree for Henry Pemberton and Caroline Towne Hollingsworth; notes and notebooks on family history, particularly the Lovering and related families of New England; notes on Thomas Heatherd of Kent County, Delaware; and a narrative genealogy "Shallcross of Pennsylvania, U.S.A." by Oliver Hough, 1907 (Leonard and John Shallcross of Philadelphia and Bucks County).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
